Speakers

Death Cab for Cutie Ticketing Information

Tickets will be on sale at 9 am, Monday September 29th at the Norris Box Office. Tickets will be $15 each, and students may buy 4 tickets per Wildcard. Limit 1 Wildcard per person. Transportation to and from the Riviera Theatre is included in the price of the tickets; transportation information to follow shortly. Cash, credit or debit is accepted, but there will be a cash-only table to move the process along as quickly as possible.

A&O Productions Fall Show: Death Cab for Cutie

A&O is proud to announce our fall blowout show, Death Cab for Cutie with special guest So Many Dynamos. The show will be October 10th at the Riviera Theatre in Downtown Chicago. Tickets will go on sale September 29th, for $15 at the Norris Box office. Transportation by bus is included in the price of tickets. Students will be able to buy 4 tickets per Wildcard, one Wildcard per person. A&O Productions would also like to remind students that we reserve the right to check Wildcards at the door of the show to ensure that all attendees are in fact Northwestern Students. Watch this space for more details closer to the sale date and show.

War Dance

War Dance// Thursday May 22 (tonight), 7PM and 10PM // Free at Swift room 107

Academy Award Nominee for Best Documentary Feature

Sean Fine and Andrea Nix Fine’s WAR DANCE is a powerful documentary that follows a group of schoolchildren as they overcome nearly insurmountable odds in their quest to participate in the annual Kampala Music Festival. For over 20 years, Northern Uganda has been a war zone, and as a vicious rebel force, the Lord’s Resistance Army, has run rampant, destroying villages, kidnapping children, and murdering parents. The 60,000 survivors are forced to live in a refugee camp, where conditions are bleak and resources are scarce. Somehow, the children of the Patongo Primary School have qualified for the Kampala Music Festival competition for the first time, a feat unto itself; yet these children are determined to take home the championship prize. As they make their way to Kampala to perform in front of an audience that doesn’t think much of them, they must band together to prove that war and famine and slaughter cannot suffocate their spirit.

http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/war_dance/#synopsis

The Lion King Sing-Along!

A&O and Mayfest present The Lion King!

The childhood classic….in sing-along form!
Tuesday, May 20th at 9PM on the Norris Lawn!

The Lion King? Sing along? Yeah, that’s right. Belt out "Nants ingonyama bagithi baba" with Rafiki ("Circle of Life", anyone?) or just chill on the lawn and enjoy this Disney classic for the self-conscious tone deaf. No matter what, the Lion King is sure to bring you back to the good ol’ grade school days when you still believed in Hakuna Matata. Lion nuzzling is encouraged but not condoned.

A&O Spring Alumni Speaker this Thursday!

Christine Hassler

Northwestern Alumna

Author of “20 Something, 20 Everything”

Faced with a career she worked hard to achieve but didn’t like and the disintegration of her relationship, author Christine Hassler started talking to other twenty-something women and discovered a pattern. Many women in their twenties (and thirties) feel unsettled and struggle to reassess their positions on what Christine calls the twenties triangle: Who am I? What do I want? How do I get it?

Come listen to Christine speak about these questions and answer your own about her experiences as a Hollywood agent, author, and NU and Kappa Alpha Theta Alum.

Thursday May 15, 2008, 7 p.m.
John Evans Alumni Center
Refreshments and Food provided
Free Admission!
1800 Sheridan Rd, Evanston, IL
(847) 491-7200

Funded by the office of the provost

christinehassler.com

A&O Films Special Event: PANGEA DAY

"Pangea Day is a global event bringing the world together through film."

This will be a truly unique experience and the first time A&O has brought something like this to campus. It is a film festival being broadcast around the world at a number of satellite locations including Northwestern’s campus. Significant talent is behind the event, as the advisory board for Pangea Day contains such names as J.J. Abrams, Meg Ryan, Cameron Diaz, Paul Simon, Forest Whitaker, and others. Come anytime for FREE to McCormick Auditorium on Saturday May 10th from 1-5PM and enjoy this incredible cultural opportunity and celebration of film.

For more information:
http://www.pangeaday.org/

Apply for A&O Executive Board 2008-2009

It’s that time of the year again, when we pick and transition to our new executive board. But before we do that, you have to apply! Don’t be afraid to apply for any position. Take your time with the application and use this as a venue to relay your wonderful, innovative ideas to the outgoing executive board.

The application is due on Tuesday, May 6th at 12pm be e-mail (see the application); we will not be accepting hard copies. The interviews will take place on the afternoon of Sunday, May 11th, so please leave that entire afternoon open. Once all the applications are in, you will receive an interview slot. Download the application by using any of the options below.

  • Download the PDF.
  • View as a web page.
  • Open it as a Google Doc if you have an @u.northwestern.edu account.

No Country for Old Men & The Savages

No Country for Old Men // Friday April 25 & Saturday April 26, 7PM and 10PM // $3 in McCormick Auditorium

The Coen brothers make their finest thriller since Fargo with a restrained adaptation of Cormac McCarthy’s novel. Not that there aren’t moments of intense violence, but No Country for Old Men is their quietest, most existential film yet. In this modern-day Western, Llewelyn Moss (Josh Brolin) is a Vietnam vet who could use a break. He finds a case filled with $2 million and Moss takes it with him and hits the road only to discover he’s being followed by ex-special ops agent Chigurh (an eerily calm Javier Bardem). Like the taciturn terminator, No Country for Old Men doesn’t move quickly, but the tension never dissipates.

The Savages // Sunday April 27, 7:30PM, FREE in Harris 107

 Jon (Philip Seymour Hoffman) and Wendy Savage (Laura Linney) are two siblings who have spent their adult years trying to recover from the memory of their abusive father. Suddenly, a call comes in that Lenny’s girlfriend has died and he cannot care for himself. Despite the fact Jon and Wendy have not spoken to Lenny for twenty years, the Savage siblings feel obliged to take care of him. As Wendy and Jon struggle to make some kind of peace with their difficult father, watching these wonderfully understated yet compelling actors is a pleasure unto itself.

One Voice and A&O Productions present: Stars and French Horn Rebellion

One Voice is a Northwestern University student initiative that aims to speak for the millions of voiceless victims who are taken advantage of and sold into forms of modern-day slavery. Working with A&O Productions, they are presenting a free benefit concert on the Norris East Lawn on April 20th featuring Stars and former Northwestern band The French Horn Rebellion. The show starts at 3. In addition to the show there will be popcorn and other assorted snacks, face painting and finger painting.

Counting Crows bus information

There will be two pickup locations at SPAC, and on Emerson near Cahn. The first busses will leave at 5:50, the next sets at 6:15, 6:45, and finally 7:10. The first busses will be there in time for doors opening so attendees can reserve good standing space. The last busses will arrive in time for the opening band. Over 1,500 students have bought tickets, but tickets are still available at the Riviera box office!
